page.title: 07SUCKLEY PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content:
{
Educational provision began in Suckley in 1628, when a Mr. J. Palmer bequeathed Â£100 to provide for a schoolmaster to teach ten boys 'read- ing, writing and the rudiments of arithmetic'. The school was in a room adjoining the church until 1877, when the church was demolished. It was replaced by a Board school, which opened on 12th February, 1877 to accommodate 136 children and which cost Â£1,900. It was extended in 1905 to house 150 children. Suckley Primary School now caters for children from the district and, since 1984, from Alfrick when that school closed. Children of secondary age are transported to high schools at Malvern.
